description: A nationwide campaign in India for the period 2014 to 2019 that aimed to clean up the streets, roads, and infrastructure of cities, towns, and rural areas.
An initiative by the Government of India to provide affordable housing to the urban poor with a target of building 20 million affordable houses by 31 March 2022.

The Mahatma Gandhi National Rural Employment Guarantee Act aims to enhance livelihood security in rural areas by providing at least 100 days of wage employment in a financial year to every household whose adult members volunteer to do unskilled manual work.

A campaign launched by the Government of India to ensure the Government's services are made available to citizens electronically by improving online infrastructure and by increasing Internet connectivity or by making the country digitally empowered in the field of technology.
A nationwide plan in India to provide good all-weather road connectivity to unconnected villages.
